trial_identification.studytitle: Exercise intervention to prevent falls, enhance mobility and increase physical activity in community dwellers after stroke: a randomised controlled trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Exercise intervention to prevent falls, enhance mobility and increase physical activity in community dwellers after stroke: a randomised controlled trial

conditions.healthcondition: Individuals after stroke residing in the community

interventions.interventions: 1 group- weekly exercise class ( 45 min per class, 40 weeks per year) and home program (up to 30 min, 5 days/week) aimed at preventing falls, enhancing mobility and increasing physical activity for 12 months.
interventions.comparator: 1 group - weekly upper limb and cognitive exercise class (45 min per class, 40 weeks) and home program (up to 30 min, 5 days per week) aimed at improving affected upper limb function and cognition for 12 months

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured monthly for 12 month study period
Measured at baseline and within a month of completing the 12 month study period
Measured at baseline and within one month of completing the 12 month study period

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.
Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.
Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.
Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.
Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.
Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.
Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.
Measured at baseline and within 1 month of completing the 12 month study period.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Suffered one or more strokes; Able to walk 10 m independently with or without an aid; able to gain medical clearance to participate; able to give informed consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Cognitive impairment (Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score less than 24); Insufficient communication or english language skills to participate safely; medical condition precluding exercise.

trial_design.concealment: sealed, sequentially numbered opaque envelopes, opened by a person independent of the study at a central independent location
trial_design.sequence: Computer generated sequence using Microsoft excel. Randomisation stratified within each stroke club with size and order of blocks random.
trial_design.designfeatures: Assessor and data analyst are blinded

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This project aims to work with the NSW Stroke Recovery Association's Stroke Club network to establish and evaluate community -based sustainable exercise programs for stroke survivors. We hypothesis that the experimental intervention ( weekly exercise class and home program for 12 months) will prevent falls and enhance mobility and increase habitual physical activity levels among people following stroke.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Sydney South Westh Area Health Service
The University of Sydney -SSWAHS Ethic Review Committee .
Stroke Clubs within the network of Stroke Recovery Association of NSW.
